article_title: IRS rules on health reform excise tax may lead to rethink of group plan design
article_text:
Many employers are likely to redesign the fastest growing group health plan design — high-deductible plans linked to health savings accounts — in the wake of forthcoming Internal Revenue Service regulations.

Those rules will deal with one of the last areas of the 2010 health care reform law to take effect: the “Cadillac” tax that will impose a 40% excise tax on
